arm_group.description: Group scanned with CT perfusion during adenosine vasodilation test.
Group scanned twice without adenosine vasodilation test for a reference. No randomization.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to investigate changes in abdominal tissue perfusion during
      adenosine vasodilation. Our hypotheses were that CT perfusion measurements are altered by
      changes in the circulatory system mediated by adenosine, and a more differentiated
      assessment of the circulatory capacity of abdominal tumours could be achieved by sequential
      rest and adenosine vasodilation CT perfusion measurements.

clinical_study.brief_title: CT Perfusion Changes in GI Cancer During Adenosine Vasodilation Test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Tumour larger than 1.5 cm on diagnostic CT

          -  Normal serum creatinine

          -  Age above 18

          -  Informed written and oral consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Contrast allergy or contrast induced nephropathy

          -  BMI > 40

          -  Asthma or Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease

          -  Heart failure (NYHA III+)

          -  Heart conduction disorder

          -  Atrial fibrillation

          -  2nd/3rd Heart block

          -  Long QT syndrome

          -  Wolf Parkinson White Syndrome

          -  Moderate / severe aortic stenosis

          -  Haemodynamic contraindications for adenosine, systolic pressure below 90

study_pop.textblock: Patients with biopsy proven tumors in esophagus or stomach

clinical_study.official_title: Abdominal Tissue Perfusion Changes in Esophageal and Gastric Cancer During Adenosine Vasodilation Measured With Computed Tomography (CT) Perfusion

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.measure: Change in arterial flow during adenosine vasodilation test (CT perfusion parameter)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

Change in Heart rate during adenosine vasodilation test

secondary_outcome.description: Area Under Curve (AUC) is correlated to cardiac output
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Area under arterial input curve during adenosine vasodilation test
Change in Blood volume (CT perfusion parameter) during adenosine vasodilation test
Change in Permeability (CT perfusion parameter) during adenosine vasodilation test.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
